questions.question_text: When is implementation of a Product Backlog item considered complete?

choices.B: When the item has no work remaining in order to be potentially released.
choices.A: At the end of the Sprint.
choices.C: When Quality Assurance reports that the item passes all acceptance criteria.
choices.D: When all work in the Sprint Backlog related to the item is finished.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"Each Increment is additive to all prior Increments and thoroughly verified, ensuring that all Increments work together."

choices.C: To review the Scrum Team's activities and processes during the Sprint.
choices.B: To inspect the product Increment with the stakeholders and collect feedback on next steps.
choices.A: To take time to judge the validity of the project.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a Sprint Review?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, increment is presented (not released, that's up to discretion of PO)

Selected Answer: BC
B,C are correct

Selected Answer: BC
B and C

questions.question_text: Choose two responsibilities of a self-organizing Development Team. (Choose two.)

choices.B: Pull Product Backlog items for the Sprint.
choices.C: Do the work planned in the Sprint Backlog.

questions.question_text: If two Scrum Teams are added to the development of a product that previously had only one Scrum Team, what will be the immediate impact on the productivity of the original Scrum Team? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.D: We do not know until a Sprint has run.
choices.B: Its productivity is likely to stay the same.
choices.C: Its productivity is likely to increase.
choices.A: Its productivity is likely to decrease.

discussion.content: The productivity of the original Scrum Team would likely decrease as they would need to take time to assist and support the new Scrum Teams in order for them to perform optimally.

Selected Answer: A
Productivity will decrease for a short period.

Selected Answer: A
When you modify the working team, the normal is that the performance decrease

comments.content: Agree think the answer is B

discussion.content: Why would adding new teams decrease the original team's productivity? ðŸ¤”

choices.D: Begin facilitating productive and useful Sprint Retrospectives.
choices.A: Call a meeting between the Scrum Team and senior management.
choices.B: Comply with the decision of the self-organizing team.
choices.C: Consult with the Product Owner to see how they feels about the situation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Scrum Master
"They do this by helping everyone understand Scrum theory and practice, both within the Scrum Team and the organization."

Selected Answer: D
scrum events are sacred

Selected Answer: D
All scrum events are mandatory

questions.question_text: A Scrum Master is introducing Scrum to a new Team. The Team has decided that a Sprint Retrospective is unnecessary. What action should the Scrum Master take?
